title: Angola: Trade Union Secretary General Calls for More Staff Training
text:
Cameroon: Suicide Bomber Attacks in Northern Cameroon 
Luanda — The secretary general of the Trade Union Confederation (UNTA-CS), Manuel Viage, Friday in Luanda appealed to the leaders of union associations across the country to conduct more training of staff in order to increase their knowledge. 
Manuel Viage launched the appeal at the opening of the First Extraordinary Meeting of the Confederation Council of Trade Union tasked with preparing its fifth congress, scheduled for next September. 
The trade unionists should increase their knowledge to enable them to perform better their professional activities, he noted. 
UNTA-CS secretary general also urged for creation of labour legislation that protects and defends the interests of Angolan workers. Angola
